definition: abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: So why is the humble chair being blacklisted?
sentences.chinese: 但为什么这次是“老实巴交”的椅子被列入黑名单呢？

sentences.english: They were blacklisted because of their extreme right-wing views.
sentences.chinese: 他们因极右观点而被列入黑名单。
这个人被列入了黑名单。

sentences.english: Black list allows you to set masks and exact emails for blocking.
sentences.chinese: 黑名单，让您可以设定口罩和确切的电子邮件的封锁。

sentences.english: You have to burn this release, since virtual drives are blacklisted.
sentences.chinese: 此版必须刻盘，虚拟光驱软件已被列入黑名单。

sentences.english: If your neighbor ends up in a blacklist, you will too.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的邻居被拉进黑名单，你也无法幸免。

sentences.english: Other individual customers approved by the Head Office to be blacklisted.
sentences.chinese: 其他经总行同意列为黑名单的客户。

sentences.english: The reaction of the ministry will be clear, Sinopec will be blacklisted.
sentences.chinese: 石油部的反应将十分明确，中石化将被列入黑名单。

sentences.english: You cannot consider blacklisting or whitelisting to be a foolproof solution.
sentences.chinese: 不能把黑名单或白名单作为一种绝对安全的解决方案。

sentences.english: View call logs for blacklisted numbers that are set in Silent mode.
sentences.chinese: 设置黑名单的号码以拒绝来电和在接其通话时的静音。

sentences.english: One method used to combat spam is blacklisting .
sentences.chinese: 用来对付垃圾邮件的方法之一就是黑名单。

sentences.english: Once throne eyes gaze, age face a dark, remember the human into blacklist.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝眼睛一瞪，老脸一黑，就把人惦记入黑名单了。

sentences.english: Mail Rules allowed users to select blacklists.
sentences.chinese: 邮件规则允许用户选择黑名单。

sentences.english: Have IPs on hand that we can switch if blacklisted.
sentences.chinese: 有手，我们可以切换，如果被列入黑名单的IP。

sentences.english: Other customers approved by the Bank to be blacklisted.
sentences.chinese: 其他经银行同意列为黑名单的客户。

sentences.english: So why is the humble chair being blacklisted?
sentences.chinese: 但为什么“老实巴交”的椅子被列入黑名单呢？

definition: to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
to reject/to refuse to take a call
to strike off (the rolls)/to remove from a list/to expunge/to expel
